title: Alabama's Brewery Guide: Drink your way across the state
text:
Click on the map pins to find the name and address of each Alabama brewery. 
Patio drinking. Signature suds. Laid back. Local business. Dogs welcome. Family friendly. 
For so many reasons, Alabama breweries are beloved. The state's oldest, currently operating brewery is only 7 years old, but the Alabama beer industry has grown at a rapid clip since Good People poured its first beer on July 4, 2008. 
Now, the Birmingham-based brewery is in good company with 22 other operating breweries and more on the way. Nearly all of Alabama's breweries and brewpubs offer tap rooms where patrons can gather with friends or neighbors who will soon become friends. On any evening at most of these institutions, you're as likely to see puppies running and children at play as you are a live band. 
As part of the ongoing Alabama's Best initiative , we've compiled a guide to Alabama breweries. Sit back, pour yourself a cold one (we recommend going local!) and plan your next trip to an Alabama brewery. Carla Jean Whitley North Alabama Breweries 
Our brewery guide is divided by region. Click through to learn more about each north Alabama brewery before continuing on to central and lower Alabama's breweries. Rebecca Walker Benjamin | rwalker@al.com
